greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n, A166590(n)), where A166590 is completely multiplicative with a(p) = p+2 for prime p.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
mathematica: a[n_] := If[n == 1, 1, GCD[n, Times@@ ((First[#]+2)^Last[#] &/@FactorInteger[n])]]; Array[a, 120] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Dec 05 2018~ *)
program: A166590(n) = { my(f = factor(n)); for(i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] += 2); factorback(f); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 05 2018
